page.title: 17SPORT IN THE BREICH VALLEY
page.content: As with many other areas of life in the Breich Valley most{sportsmen have {to travel to find sporting facilities, the only exception being football.In fact footballers are well served with amateur teams in each village and a Junior side in Stoneyburn. Other sports don't fare so well. Swimmers have to travel to Whitburn, golfers to Bathgate, athletes to Fauldhouse,gymnasts and rugby players to Livingston. The local Community Centres have offered a variety of sports in the past but for a number of reasons interest does not last long. One bright spot is that plans are afoot to build a floodlit,all-weather pitch,suitable for tennis and football, in Addiewell.
